DOC.HEAD: Summary of Events in Romania
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Here is a summary of events Tuesday in Romania:

_Romanian television shows tape of deposed leader Nicolae Ceausescu and his wife, Elena, after they were executed by firing squad for crimes against Romania. They lay crumpled on the ground in front of a bullet-riddled wall. Earlier, television showed footage of the couple at what is believed to have been their secret trial. _ Romanians cheer the executions and Romanian sources say the security forces loyal to Ceausescu are beginning to surrender en masse. _ The new revolutionary government says Ceausescu and his security forces killed 60,000 people during his 24-year rule. Television shows what is described as a torture chamber in Timisoara. _The revolutionary council names its informal leader, Ion Iliescu, a former official ousted by Ceausescu, as chairman of the governing council. It also names Petre Roman, a 43-year-old professor of hydraulic engineeering with no political background, as prime minister. _ The provisional leadership repeals travel restrictions and other hated Ceausescu laws, lifting the dictator's orders to destroy thousands of rural villages and move the residents into the cities. It revokes family planning restrictions, rules on talking to foreigners and allows Romanians unrestricted ownership of such once-regulated items as typewriters. _ The Interior Ministry loses control of the security forces, which are put under the jurisdiction of the Defense Ministry, which controls the army. It was the army that sided with pro-democracy protesters when revolution broke out, and security forces who remained loyal to Ceausescu.
